intro: Botryanthus lafarinae, commonly known as the Cape rose or sweet thorn, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters. The plant produces small, fragrant white or pink flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are pinnate and its fruit is a capsule containing numerous seeds. Botryanthus lafarinae is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
